overview_of_class:
We will begin with an overview of contemporary approaches to Christian ethics, with some attention to their historical background, and then move to discussions of guidelines for ethical analysis and action that have been proposed by representative Roman Catholic, mainline Protestant, and conservative Evangelical moralists. Topics to be discussed include war, economy, capital punishment, and sexuality.   

Counts towards the Religion, Law and Politics (RLP) , Religion, Health and Medicine (RHM) and Religion, Sexuality and Gender (RSG) major concentrations.
name: Christian Ethics
